FwjefZES3ntDSt-NqZwPWw.text: The service here is great. The hostesses and servers were on point. A couple of reasons why I give it two stars is mainly because of the drinks and the food. I ordered a Jameson on the rocks and it came back watery which meant it was shaken. No big deal because I asked for my second Jameson on the rocks not shaken which is what I prefer. The fried pickles were really good and the caesar salad was kind of okay. I really wished they had the nachos! What made me disappointed was the fact that my Jameson drinks had an up charge of 1.50$ for being "on the rocks." So basically an extra 3$ added to the tab because I had ice in my Jameson. To me I think this is ridiculous, I have never seen this before and it doesn't make sense to up charge this. IF I come back, I will have to ask about the certain up charges.

ez_oMtz0Aq1zNvDkQ5rKwA.text: This place is awesome. The patio is unlike anything else I've seen in Arizona. The beers are great and so is the food. Open up one in Gilbert/Chandler!

j_nCvP-QPzbXzRxGoXsQNw.text: You MUST TRY the #Dubbel, the #Trippel if you dare, house brewed and both quite excellent!  With a wide variety of different types of house brewed beers (some of them award winning) and a TON of both domestic and imported drafts, this brew master definitely knows what he/she is up to!! If you like great service, tasty eats, modern/chic motif,  and most importantly delicious beer, then this is a mandatory stop on an ever-groundhogish-Mill Street. This microgastrobrew is a breath of fresh air, and a very welcomed one at that.   Be forewarned, if you come when the brew master is hard at work, you'll probably want to sit outside unless the smell doesn't bother you and/or your companion. Just remember that it'll all be worthwhile once you get a taste of the sweet sweet nectar at Pedal Haus Brewery.   NOTE: Not good for kids though, yes there is a "play area"  but it's obviously meant for adults people.

GPl7t8c6I-NHD43aqap5Fw.text: My cousin and I stopped by to grab a bite for lunch and completely forgot the PF Changs Rock n Roll marathon was finishing up. This place was completely packed but had an amazing vibe. We got a few seats at the bar and ordered a nice cold Pilsner! Wow o wow! Loved that beer so much I had to order another one. We both ordered the green chili burger and it is by far my favorite burger on Mill Ave! I would definitely come back with the hubby and chill outside on their beautiful patio!

89JkkF8-NoA9FmTsDr1udQ.text: Food was okay. Service was horrible, server had left for the night without telling us she was transferring our table, never came back to ask if we wanted another round. BEER WAS DECENT. Honestly server ruined my experience.

k-ms-4C2Sid2-hk3AxWb6A.text: Came for a beer with some friends and ended up staying all night! Had some great muscles and the best chicken finers I've ever had.   The in house 6 month barrel aged quad was delicious and the Berliner Weiss brewed by the women of Pedal Haus and Four Peaks was crisp, clean, and came with an empowering back story considering the craft beer world is nowadays thought of as a male dominated niche.    We played ping pong and bags all night! The layout is warm and sofisticated, Kade was a great server and Gus was a super knowledgeable bartender! Me and my girlfriends have made this our new home

6KH_zuKzVdv5jgqp64u16Q.text: 2 stars is me being nice. Short review = go to Culinary Drop Out down the street.... FOR REALZ!!  The lower star reviews could not be more right! I thought well....let's try it out anyways...welp shame on me. The 2 stars are for average service, polite hostess and bacon wrapped dates. We ordered the Green Chilie Burger, Bacon wrapped dates and two beers. All of the reviews regarding them being out of beers is the straight truth!! Not only were they out of their own IPA, they had beers listed that they have not carried for 3 months now. The burger was severely undercooked and bland, the dates were on point but not worth 10 bucks...2.00 per date  when we brought up the issue of the undercooked burger we were given a shoulder shrugging "sorry"....lol ok whatever i'm never coming back here again....like never ever!

aB4dXy-W25JHvG7Og2BUuw.text: Love this place! Love the menu! The atmosphere here is so relaxing. I can seriously come here once a week and try everthing on the menu! Burgers are amazing, chicken pot pie was the best I ever tasted and simply fell in love with the bacon wrapped dates! And please please try the deviled eggs....... It has BACON!

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. All your beer options!

N8GhxVdjeVMzyMA5tJYgag.text: Had my birthday here! Reserved a fire pit which had heaters and its own private TV as well. Very cool atmosphere and great service. Some of my friends ordered food and said it was delicious. Can't wait to go back and see for myself.

-TaKGMhbRTOV5pnMle_VSA.text: Went there last night after Rowing class, was HUNGRY!  We split a Ruben sandwich  and salad (instead of fries). The salad was pretty big and most delicious!!! They put the perfect amount of dressing and it had a great mix of greens! The Ruben was fantastic!!! Their 'kraut was different yet good.  We ordered it on the side and honestly, the sandwich was perfectly great without it (does that still make it a Ruben?? Humm). Great beer selection as well. Will be here again to replace any calories I burned off while Rowing!! Lol

hT5hofs9uZibwetiyIoA3g.text: My husband and I loved the atmosphere of Pedal Haus. So many places to sit, fire pits, open air, outside seating, cool atmosphere with the brewery feel. Menu was great, lots of options for food and drinks. Cute little area in Tempe to walk around after your meal or you can stay and play the hard games Pedal Haus provides. So fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salmon salad with orange miso dressing... so good!
Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Burger with a side salad for my hubby

0S78gBHoD72ydQ7iETB8Rw.text: This isn't your average brew pub.  There are outdoor fire pits, games, ping pong, corn hole and more. The Pedal Haus is located next to a multiplex movie theater so it's a great place to go to before or after a movie. We had a Mediterranean platter to share, salmon, fish and chips and everything was very good. I normally don't care for heavy and greasy pub food but this was lighter, much more thought out and well made.  I went for the beer sampler, receiving five 4 oz beers and they were all very good.  Next time we're in town I will definitely stop by the Pedal Haus.

iwIkf0NlEpHTSEtOysYyRQ.text: Liked the atmosphere and the setup of this place but the food is no good. Had a falafel sandwich with salad. The salad consisted of lettuce an 2 cherry tomato halves.  The falafel were hard and didn't taste good.  Too much bread, not enough Tsaziki, very dry. Probably the worst falafel I ever had.  Other people at our table weren't impressed with their meals either.  It's too bad cause you would expect better food from a place in a location like that. Definitely won't be going back.

80dJGG4IOv0UcmcGMb_rvA.text: Good sports bar to go hang out with some friends on mill. They have a good selection of beer on tap. They have some games and seating outside and inside. They also have a private area that you can rent out to have a small party or get together. I was actually surprised at how good the food was. Their hummus and middle eastern food is very good. The reason I'm giving this place 3 stars is that when it gets busy the service is lacking. Plus there were points that there was a line and the bar tenders were chatting instead of helping costumers. They do validate parking but only if you park to the side off them. Not if you park in the Chase parking structure.

L2KnFaPJmG9nkmm5fsGaQQ.text: The location and patio area were great and the servers were very efficient.  The beer was decent. The negative was the they advertise free validated parking at the structure;  when I presented my parking ticket to the server he said it did not apply to the structure connected to the rear., the actual structure was a further walk somewhere down the street and I ended paying $12.00 for 1 hour of parking. I ordered a blue cheese burger medium and ended up with well done.  The cheese didn't taste right and made me sick the rest of the night.

4SvTwjbH-Q94oRMg37ssvQ.text: They recently remodeled over the summer of 2016, and it looks great! The outdoor seating is laid out in a really cool way, with half-circle "booths" that have fire pits in the middle. There are also some games (ping pong, cornhole, etc.). Indoor seating seems like it was reduced.  I only had drinks so I can't speak to the quality of the food. Their service was fairly good as well. Overall, it's a solid place in Tempe to eat, drink, and spend time with friends!

eHkgbxicvnevdntmPYGhWQ.text: Chicken fingers are amazing!! Very sad to see that they took cheese curds off the menu  but I guess life goes on

q6v4BmEj-ND_DBet5EI_hg.text: Fantastic beers. It's wonderful to find a brewery that isn't heavy on hops. The triple is the best I've found outside of Belgium. The quad is fantastic. I am excited to try whatever they brew up next.

i-cgV_u2I29Fr3_205iskw.text: Love this place.  Best patio with afternoon shade. Beers are awesome.   Tyler the bar manager is super friendly - one of best I've seen behind a bar.   Update: The renovation is awesome.  Beautiful patio and more outdoor bar area.  The service was so good.  Our bartender Sherry went beyond great!!

g8x_N4abwullxohU7hcH2w.text: I don't get to Tempe very often but I'm glad I made it to this spot last weekend. Pedal Haus Brewery is a local microbrewery that also features outside brews. The space itself is very open and inviting. It's getting a bit too toasty for patio seating but their patio looks amazing!   I ordered the Rose Royale {Hendricks Gin | Haus  made sweet & sour | fresh raspberries | Champagne} it was the perfect refresher after an hour of paddle boarding on the lake. For an appetizer we went with the nachos and holy moly they are HUGE! So big I actually thought about cancelling my main course. Honestly, these were some of the best nachos ever! I consider myself a nacho connoisseur (seriously it should be on my resume). These do not disappoint! The generous toppings of chicken chili verde, black beans, corn, queso, pickled Fresno peppers, and lime crema made it almost impossible to stop eating. I showed a little more restraint and ordered the Haus Salad composed of mixed greens, tomato, cucumber, red onion, feta, and balsamic vinaigrette. Pretty standard but still good. As always I could use more feta. I also was able to try a bite of the green chili bacon burger. It was much more satisfying than my salad! I don't normally order burgers but I would consider it here! The green chili and Jack cheese combo was to die for!   Service was ok. At first it was really quick and efficient but toward the end we found ourselves waiting for the check for a good 10-15 min. That was my only gripe. If I find myself in the area again i would definitely come back!

kroPzfW6YZxBoStWSR16RQ.text: This place is really cool. The decor is really tasteful and interesting. The patio outside is comfortable and fun. The food is great. I had a good Reuben, my wife had a great salad, and my mother in law had some really tasty fish and chips (we share food in our family ). This place has tons of great beer-- I had a tasty IPA. And it's in a super rad location. Two thumbs up!

um2K2xGyqbSPOf6iHGpDkQ.text: My most favorite bar on mill avenue. They have a great range of beers. The food is delicious, specially dolmades. Great place to relax with friends and family with games and good music. Their coffee brew and cocktails are a must try. Loved the open seating they offer!

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States

wn7V-WrFcP389FVjPtHVWg.text: We have been coming here since this place opened and absolutely loved it. We had a bad experience about 3 months ago because they changed their menu and the quality was horrible. We decided to give it a second chance and we will never come back. They completely changed their menu there is one German item on it. If you enjoy eating a half melted block of cheese on top of a soggy flatbread, this is the place for you. I ordered the my boy bleu burger and they brought me the fancy burger. I ordered my burger medium and when they brought the correct burger it was a hockey puck. So. Overcooked. The bun was three days old and falling apart. It's a shame because their beers are on point but their food is so beyond subpar it's ridiculous. They have such a high turnover of staff, there is not a single employee we've seen more than once here unlike our normal spots, so there is definitely something up.

naZb2dXAKniJnSeAXgy-EQ.text: 3 facts about my experience at Pedal Haus  1.) I sent back my salad because I didn't like it  2.) the manager literally totally me to "go fuck myself" (the bald guy) 3.) they charged my card, but I paid in cash.

3gE7Uos4RLRKHywevZatwg.text: DRINK REVIEW ONLY. FYI, if you check in on Facebook, you get an extra 30 minutes of happy hour. Woo!   We went for drinks at happy hours (3-6pm weekdays) on a Friday and the place was completely packed. They have an incredible outdoor space complete with a of couple corn hole sets. A great option for hanging out with coworkers or friends after work.  I had the Farmhouse Ale and the  Koffee Kolsch.   The Farmhouse Ale was light and smooth. It touts an impressive ABV at 10%. For a $4 happy hour price, you can't go wrong.   The real highlight was the Koffee Kolsch. Holy smokes. It was SO good. The smell was incredibly enticing and aromatic. Sometimes that's where the flavor profile ends, but not with this beer. The coffee flavor was near exquisite. I wish I had gotten two of these! I'll definitely be looking for it in stores, because OH MY GOD IT'S SO GOOD.

o3KieV5ZFa-NtJ-HaYuYEA.text: My son and his new wife had a wedding reception dinner here 2 weeks ago and it was beautiful.  The staff was nice and attentive. We had a delicious buffet dinner. Their private room with family style table and benches accommodated our party of 25 easily.  I am not a big fan of breweries so I was very pleased to have the server suggest a few cocktails.  Hoping to go back soon to enjoy more of the pretzel and cheese appetizer. Also having the parking garage nearby was a plus ++.

ji2JX0D8H7l6dFX5CFDfkQ.text: Excellent, service was great, the experience was incredible, pizza is really good with fresh ingredients, suggest the side of green beens  with bacon and onions,  incredible!!! The patio rocks with great music at a perfect volume, we'll be back...

AET9GqBKSv_4VbrxzOHB_g.text: I just sat for 17 minutes without anyone asking me if I wanted to drink. There are 20 other places on Mill that I could go and get good service, I won't be coming back.

Infxc1G0w9HIsrDgKksphQ.text: I sat at the bar closest to the main entry.  I was able to quickly place my order, but prior to receiving my Kolsch the bartender asked for a card to hold and before even waiting for a response he was off.  When I received my beer is was asked again for a card, but once again he left before I could respond.  My beer was at least 1 1/8" below full upon arrival.  At first I thought ok maybe they serve all of their beers not quite full, but then the person three bar stools to my right got a completely full beer.  A short time later my side arrived (Brussels and Bacon) and for a third time I was asked for a card at which time I held up my $20 since I intended to pay with cash.  The bartender took my cash and vanished yet again returning with a cash drawer to add to his register.  While he was gone I experienced very over cooked mildly burnt dry Brussels and almost no bacon or bacon flavor.  The bartender then returned with my change (He gave me two 5's and a single) 11 bucks change from a twenty and dropped of the receipt which showed a total including tax of $10.81, so I did a double take and discovered I was undercharged.  I got his attention and showed him the receipt and the change; he thanked me for being honest and pointing it out.  He disappears again to get the "right change" only to return with a five spot and four singles I know it's only .19 but damn get it right.  Long story short the BEER was descent the FOOD was horrible and be prepared to give them a card or cash right away.  If you do pay in cash don't expect the change to be correct.

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kolsch not quite a full pour.  Should I feel cheated?

iENe1k-V9wef_7z4RDKM5A.text: First off.........what cool looking place. Hands down the most beautiful in downtown Tempe. I'm totally coming back here to day drink. 2nd.......Beer is legit. I had a couple IPA's that were on the menu. Apps.......had the cheese curds......THE BOMB Lastly the food. Mom said the cheese burger was great. She usually only eats half, then takes the other half home.......she killed it.  I had the cuban, the recommendation from the waitress......it was ok. I wasn't wow'd. I will totally be back!!!!

kp06bgykY7oWIid14vFH1w.text: I'd give this place a four star if the bartender practiced better hygiene. My sister was a health inspector and my brother is a chef, so they are very adamant about restaraunt employees cleanliness. Our bartender blew his nose with a bar napkin, threw it in the trash, wiped his hands on the towel in his back pocket, grabbed some beer steins then took someone's credit card for payment.  There goes my food order. I didn't order anything. But..the actual establishment was fun! Games all around! Televisions by the boatload! A good place to go if you want to have adult fun....and maybe get boogers on your glass or plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breweryyyyyy

A-Z1ZLl6RwRuIYyd8-YSTg.text: This is one of the hardest reviews to write because I enjoyed our first visit. We had a short wait, followed by quick seating. There are plenty of TVs for your viewing enjoyment. Our waiter was nice and provided recommendations with a smile. Small number of menu items, which is good to concentrate on taste and service. I ordered a Belgian beer and my friend ordered a margarita. Both were very tasty. It was a nice evening after the DC Wonder Woman 10k. Here's the hard part. We ordered the 'haus specialty' chicken pot pie. It was a perfect portion and tasted great. Perhaps a fluke, but my friend and I both got sick that evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Pot Pie
Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Inside view

zLg_Q70x5FoxFu3IVN6SJA.text: First impressions:  It looks like a really cool Brewery!  It's very large, has TVs almost everywhere in the place, and was the perfect vibe for our hungover Sunday brunch.  Got a seat right away and the interior was pretty empty.  Food: Ok. I got the Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich, which was tasty and I ate every bite. So I can't complain. But they loaded it with condiments, so my bottom bun was drenched and my plate had a pool on it! Again, ate it all, but it was a little overkill. The fries were ok. My wife got a wedge salad and asked to remove a few ingredients, they didn't listen or it didnt get back to the kitchen because she had to pick out everything from her salad. Again, not the end of the world. But the salad was not great.  We make better salads at home.   Drinks: This was the painful one for me.  The drinks were overall underwhelming.  I had a Bloody Mary and it was very average. But I had the Mexican Amber and it has a weird metallic aftertaste. It wasn't good. My wife had the Blanche and it was the best one! Recommend that one.  Service: spotty. They would disappear, which wouldn't be a problem for us if they were slammed, but there was nobody inside. We asked for tasters (of the Amber ale) and that should signal we are about to order a beer. Took 5-10 for the sampler to come and then another 15 mins for someone to come back so we could order. I'd pass on the Amber btw. Go with the Blonde Blanche.  Not sure we would go back sadly.

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich

dXgr5xNsSUgMyFe4_C1UmQ.text: Came here today with a bar crawl crew about 30 deep. This was our 6th stop, came to the bar and was greeted by Nick. Felt nervous about needing water and ordering it, Nick without hesitation got us two ice waters and was so pleasant, I will be back just to take care of him. Was happy to order my next few rounds with him

AhMhPgc1Jv3j3ocGW88oCw.text: We wandered into this brewery while looking around on Mill Ave on Saturday, 6/23/2018. We're in our early 40's but still like a good brewery! First impression was that of a fun, lively place. This establishment has a fantastic patio! The waitstaff was extremely attractive as well. The atmosphere was that of, "light industry/factory/warehouse." It was clean and interesting.  Our waitress, though very attractive, messed up our appetizer and salad dressing choices. I was thinking, "wow, she screwed up twice, good thing she's hot". After I told her about each issue, she offered immediately to fix both, and did. I respected her for that. *Side note: "Looks fade; your heart and soul matter the most." Just because someone is hot DOES NOT mean you want to spend the REST OF YOUR LIFE with them! Think about it GUYS!  We DID have +fantastic+ Reuben sandwiches - best I've had in years! I would go back JUST for those sandwiches! Our appetizer was delicious, but the salads that came with our sandwiches were tasteless; as if they had NO dressing at all. I lodged a complaint, but I doubt it will matter.  For the record, the Phoenix area/ASU has a ton of hot women. The problem is, some or a lot of them, "fake the funk"- they just don't care about service while working as wait staff. This brewery is near ASU so there you go. Though most non-religious college guys just want to get laid, and don't care about service, I understand the brewery's marketing approach.

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Reuben sandwich - it was awesome – best Reuben I’ve had in years! The salad that came with it was bland; no dressing, was mostly leaves
Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Our appetizer: Hummus – it was delicious!

Wl7a-yotQLxfdha9lLJ3eQ.text: Came to get drinks with friends and a light dinner. The American IPA was good. I wish they had a bigger selection of craft brews especially since they are a brewery. We split the orange and beat salad and it was decent but a bit overpriced (didn't get pics because we ate it before we remembered to take pics). We added chicken onto the salad and it was definitely not worth the extra $3. Hardly any chicken was added. If you come here, go for the bar food because everyone else's food looked great. I'll definitely go for that next time I'm here

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States

s3nSdEAzuw6VuMguYgPWRg.text: Pedal Haus is very yummy. Great beer, food and atmosphere to go along with it.   I did want to mention the last time I went, I ordered their Nashville Hot chicken sandwich from their menu. I was surprised when they brought out a buffalo chicken sandwich.   The only reason this place does not get a 5-star rating is the "Nashville Hot Chicken" is just a fried chicken breast with buffalo sauce. Little bit of False advertising, but never the less, I put that sandwich in my belly.

Dd0n3aU_LTNRot1RKHP59Q.text: We've been left behind by some waitresses with the new menu, never been served. But when they're on The beer lis great, we like to participate. Good food good service sothe only thing that is keeping it from five star is is that they do not know the magic of Pulque and the staff is primarily monolingual, so if your from another country you'll need a passport.  I have gone and the staff has been lost or ambivalent about seating so I have moved on several times. As good as the beer is bad service is not worth it in downtown Tempe.

R_7RqJGRsEO5kPksl8ZcAg.text: Pedal Haus is a great spot. It's got a unique and good size inside dining area. The patio is even better as it houses two bars, various covered seating spots, and games like corn hole. The patio is a great spot for groups of people. The food is good as are the beers. This last visit I just had a small order of wings and a few beers. I encourage you to try the coffee kolsch, it was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States

HHdPzVZ4GL5vAzSw5vfkxQ.text: Best outdoor patio in Tempe! The Sunday Funday specials are the best including 1/2 price wings! They put on some fun parties including st patty's day and a Christmas dinner! The beer selection is decent, not too many visiting taps so be prepared to try the pedal haus beer - my favorite is the white rabbit and the light lager!

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Beer makes me happy!
Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. St Patty&#39;s Day!

ZHDDcn-8DOtM69fTf1Jrwg.text: Great food, service and drinks.  I had their Mexican Lager which was very good. My wife had a Moscow Mule that was really good.  We ordered an appetizer of fried pickles. They came in spears and slices. I'm not a pickle fan but these went down easily.  I ordered a fried chicken salad. Excellent! My wife went with the Margherita pizza and said that it was great.  Service was also excellent.

795CoAlP96zpkYLlvwkbiA.text: Food was above average besides the Ruben we ordered. Might be the best one I've ever had and I have had many of them from Nebraska (where the Ruben was invented) did a couple flights of beer. The Apricot Sour was our favorite but this is a summer special so it may not be there for long. Really cool vibe here in the Mill Ave District

eOPgcxnQbhQG_p582Bd_iQ.text: Didn't eat here, just had beer. Great service, beer nice and cold. Great hangout if I lived in Arizona.

NtVjE7XaBsljrLujzi3Pyg.text: I really wanted to like this place because it has such an excellent location and their menu looks awesome.  My concern is that their water tastes terrible and it affects anything that comes out of their tap. I'm concerned that if it tastes bad what are they using to brew there Beer with? Also I found their drinks and food to be a bit overpriced and overcooked to the point of greasy. There are too many great places to enjoy downtown Tempe that I won't be trying this place again

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dinner date!
Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Date night with corn hole
Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great way to wrap up a Wednesday

4Gl8iGyUhAz8ln5-9hIAeQ.text: DATE SPOT ALERT  This is my favorite place to come with my boyfriend on a casual date night. There are plenty of TV's to entertain my boyfriend's sport related needs...;) Not to mention he loves the steins they offer and the rotation beer selection   HOWEVER, I like it because majority of it is outside and has lots of open windows that don't make you feel cramped up inside.   We always split the wedge salad and this time we tried the Reuben- classic.   Yes, I got a cosmopolitan at a brewery. Sorry not sorry

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. wedge salad and Reuben:)

U1X4uLxEHs2rSZvndrK7jw.text: My most recent visit here was during the Oktoberfest in 2018. We were expecting a giant crowd during this time of the year, however, we were pleasantly surprised to see that the environment was relaxing. As tradition goes, it is customary to have "steins" of beer at this event, and so we did. And the beer was good! I was initially skeptical of ordering food here as well, especially during this event, but we eventually did order food towards the evening, and were pleasantly surprised yet again! We ordered burgers, pasta and pot pies, and ALL of them were great. The evening was followed by some friendly competitions like the stein holding event and the sausage eating race, which were conducted in a very orderly manner. The people were friendly, service was prompt, the games section is well maintained, and the waitresses were polite - leading to a great overall experience! :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Oktoberfest at Pedal Haus!

ys9OMXzJzFANrlj6TVTkiA.text: Awesome atmosphere and brews! This place is huge! Whether you want to sit outside or inside, play games or just hang at a bar this place has it all!   The design is really unique and makes it a really fun place to relax. There is a private room you can rent for events or can sit around fire pits outside when it's cold.   I just stopped in for their Haus IPA and was impressed! Didn't get any food but it looks great. Don't know why I didn't try this place earlier .

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Free parking and Happy Hour deals

xdFbtBchIE2a37axhoFAxA.text: The staff was great + attentive - clean bathroom. Now lets talk about food!!! I tried their cauliflower buffaloes and mac and cheese!m. Portion was great and pretty tasty. I refilled my moscow mule (not a beer fan) but overall, this place is great to hang out + watch the game. Will come back when I'm in Tempe!

HrjadN6HACZuhN-ujVbTMw.text: Great place for food and drinks. The ambiance, wait staff and location are all top notch. Great local brew and overall fun place to hangout for happy hour or date night. Their food is delicious (I've had pretty much the entire menu at sometime). Cold beers, great cocktails. Try their shishito peppers with the Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich. They also have cornhole and ping pong on the patio. If you've got relatives coming into town, take them here. Lunch beers? Date night before seeing a performance at Gammage? This is the place to go prior or after. Love Pedal Haus. ~ ENJOY!

gSjhQUiuBr_D164eBN1lSg.text: Very cool vibe! Grab a flight of beers and order! Make sure to get the pretzel with beer cheese as a starter.  The Rueben was fantastic!

EO5ZRSfFafQ_8vZJnNhHIw.text: I felt like a turkey when I walked in cause I did not know this was a Brewery. I had the PedalHaus Dubbel, which was remarkably balanced and smooth... like dangerously smooth! I paired it with the Mac n cheese, which was so creamy I wanted to dance the night away with it.   The layout is fantastically huge! I love the patio and look forward to returning with my cycling buddies for our bike and beer rides. The staff was very attentive and nice. I give it a 4 because the burgers will determine if I raise it to a 5. But the Poutine my friend let me grab a bite of was out of this world! The flavor profiles for the items were on point! Plus they have an open kitchen, which I love, love, LOVE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mini brats and dubbel... yum!!!

zgum_l5pQlZogDnNssy0_A.text: Beer selection was noteworthy, the atmosphere was great (indoor/outdoor seating), the clientele was eclectic, ranging in all ages, and all food I tried was exceptional. The ghost pepper cheesesteak was likely the best cheesesteak I have ever experienced. Yes, it is hot, but not as hot as the name would lead you to believe. I will eat here every time in Tempe.

UjBYMuKhUBfZ66KD_fIIcA.text: We loved it! Even though we're not drinkers. The food, service and atmosphere was totally awesome!!! We will definitely come back!!! Tempe is the place to be for Super Bowl Sunday. Thanks for the great experience!!!!!!

j75DXkFJsgrLefYclRgnWA.text: 5 stars for the facility itself and the decor. 3 stars for the food. 3 out of the 4 people at my table had fries come with their meal and we all agreed they were way too salty. My lobster roll wasn't bad, but it certainly wasn't memorable. I'll be trying something different next time. Plenty of beer choices and the staff is friendly. Great place to go with a large group to watch sports games. You have many choices as far as what kind of seating arrangements: outdoor bar, indoor bar, regular tables,  patio furniture, open style seating, etc. Outdoor games and activities as well! Lots of outside seating but there are plenty of space heaters to keep you toasty. Overall recommend for large groups looking for a spot to hang out for a few hours.

lkxAB6Tv__WFiwvqhCQn-g.text: Met with co workers for an end of year holiday party.  We sat in a private area we had our own Tv, and sliding glass doors! I had the ghost house pepper cheesesteak which came with fries-- I did ask for au jus sauce on the side, sandwich was delicious not too hot, little bit of spice in each bite.  Service was great we had two waitress for our total party of 13 people. The remodel looks great! It wasn't too busy but there a decent amount of people for a Wednesday.  They had ping pong, corn hole, and plenty of TVs and fire pit.  Pricing is average cheesesteak was $12.  Will be back would like to check it out on the weekend.

3jN4ho5L8WhqwLGt7DghYA.text: Decided to go here last minute with some friends before going to the movies. From the outside, this place is a powerhouse. It's huge! There's a large outdoor patio and also a nice indoor seating area. When we walked in we were greeted and seated in the back. We got our drink orders in quickly (we all opted for the pedal hause beers). They arrived quickly. I got the nitro and it was honestly bland and flat. Would not recommend.   When we went to order our food we were informed that 2 of the 4 burgers were no longer available (8pm on a Saturday night). Considering the menu was pretty small, it was disappointing. I ordered the chicken pot pie. I figured it must be the signature dish bc it had a spot all on its own on the menu. My friends ordered the steak frites, and mushroom and asparagus pasta. My vegetarian friend was disappointed w the lack of options. Literally salad or the pasta. She asked if they had any veggie burgers and the waitress said they have turkey burgers at lunch. It seems weird that in 2015 restaurants (especially in a liberal college town) don't carry veggie patties as a burger alternative.  That being said, all of our food was delicious. My pot pie was crisp and fluffy on top with warm highly seasoned chickeny goodness inside. I totally get why it has its own place on the menu. I gave their in house brews another try with the porterhause. Perfect dark beer, they redeemed themselves.  All in all I would definitely come back. It's a festive, quick, and convenient place w pretty yummy food. They had a big apps menu that I would love to try next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken pot pie. Fluffy on top warm and tasty on the inside.

vPSNLmlOcPTuSHRypGl0Kw.text: Came here w/ a group of 15 guys after a day on the links and had a great time. We sat outside on the long tables w/benches which were perfect to accommodate our large group. Servers ensured our varied beverage orders were promptly met, and the beer options were excellent.  Several guys hit the Baggo courts, and I liked the comfortable viewing chairs that lined the "field of play". All around fun place.  Cheers! RS

5xzNYUxBQxjIia5cQZWv_A.text: First of all, Kade is awesome! We had a huge group and Kade brought his A game. This is not your typical Tempe bar. The craft cocktails were really good, the atmosphere is fun and inviting (even if you are over 30). Great for groups which is hard to find!

MMKGKv1F-HdCwFyGkMGlBA.text: I give two stars because at least the hostess was gracious enough to seat our party. We came in today and after being seated for 15 min with no server coming to our table we became a bit impatient. With it being chilly & being seated outside we waved down a male server to receive assistance with the heat lamp, his response was "Not right now" and he stormed off. Currently working as a server I can tell you they weren't even close to being too busy to help us, and having dinner with them before the mediocre food was barely enough to bring us back, with the now rude behavior from their servers we will not return. Sad.

ODWqzegFRAmsQxtLM3M0Tg.text: Love this place! Fire pits, ping pong,corn hole, TV's everywhere that there's not a bad seat in the place, good food and great drinks too! This is definitely my go to place on Mill moving forward.

_ALsEltvMm4hxB0ejoS1dA.text: The food was great. Loved the atmosphere outside in the beer garden.   I ordered the pint and beer and there were two fruit flies in my Jameson shot . The manager Michael came over; he was really casual and nice, he sent another shot my way.   I was surprised once I got the shot and it wasn't even comped on my bill? I'm not trying to get anything free, but don't say we'll take care of it and then not comp it. Seems like an industry standard to comp in that situation.   Not sure I'd seek this place out anymore.

ALC4xy0e1FfdttyQGlKh2Q.text: Great atmosphere and super fun environment. I appreciated that they had ceiling fans (although the one above us wasn't working) and misters going to keep it comfortable. Enjoyed playing some bag toss as well as ping pong.   Food: I had the haus salad with Salmon and it was ok. Nothing overly amazing about it.   Service: Not great. We saw the guy filling water glasses more than we saw our server and we had a group of about 15 people. I think they were definitely under staffed (we had a reservation) and the server we had didn't seem to know anything about the menu, the beers, the games etc. Our group ended up just going to the bar to order drinks and food about 45 minutes into our evening there because everyone go tired of waiting on our missing server.  I would go again, but I would order something else to eat and would insist on a different server.

oNGdP5gWT35-GrhnpSNslw.text: Love the feel and vibe of this place the remodel is nice. The games and outdoor spaces are nice addition. We waited for a table however when many tables were open in an area that was very warm not waiting friendly. Once seated we had to wait a long time for orders and we are pretty sure they forgot one item that they said was getting extra attention. The food however was great we loved appetizers and we had chicken pot pie it was a great flavor. Beer was also very good. Had to send ice tea back it was actually thick....why??? If it weren't for limitations in customer service would have given them a 4 star review. Staff are quite nice just scarce.

sdOm4D8WY58S9-iZeYcqZw.text: PH has used this space wonderfully - very modern and great energy. After having a drink at the bar while we were waiting for our large table, we ordered the chicken pot pie and mussels with fries. Very tasty but they should have put the fries on the side instead of making it soggy with it being in the same pot. We also shared the bacon wrapped dates and they were super yummy and flavorful, cooked to perfection served with a spring of herbs.  Cannot wait to come back and try other dishes! It's fun for a group event or to watch sports!

GXPxGoo_Cboa1PvLBxSvhw.text: They need to figure their shit out!!! This is not an upscale place so why are they charging $8 for bourbon & another $4 for an old fashion, when I did not ask for a specific kind of alcohol? (This isn't the gladly)Nachos we bellow par there was very lil cheese and toppings on them we had to ask for additional toppings to turn our chips into nachos but chicken finger were decent. Their signature "moonshine Paloma " was just tequila with lil Paloma. So basically we paid $60 for 3 drinks chicken fingers and nachos! On the upside our waitress Mackenzie was very sweet and accommodating!   Work your shit out before your grand opening!

dQvpdzlFkPCQhcpfuxeH1w.text: About a week or two ago I went to Pedal Haus, we go often, I even had my bday here a couple years back, anyway, I'd never gotten around to writing a review. So me and my bf eat keto so we come here and order wings with their buffalo sauce, shishito peppers, side salad, and the roasted Brussels sprouts and we add a fried egg on top because WE LOVE EGGS! Haha anyway the last time we were here we ordered the usual and my bf took a bite of one of the wings and it was sweet. If you're unfamiliar with keto it means we eat very little carbs, high fat, and absolutely no sugar. So we flagged down the manager and let him know the buffalo sauce was sweet. He said there was no sugar in the recipe but that he'd check with the kitchen, he came back and said there was no sugar, but that if we thought they tasted sweet that he'd switch them out for us. We put the first wings aside and they took them away. The manager then came back and told us they tried the wings and they were indeed sweet, someone had messed up the recipe for the buffalo sauce! We knew we weren't crazy!  anyway, we are so thankful because they made it right for us. We love Pedal Haus

gsDIYVbxYnVrC9Uha9r_1g.text: As other reviewers have mentioned, this place is huge.  They actually have three bar areas and a large outside patio in addition to the main dining area.  I sat at the bar and the service was very good.  The cheddar burger with fries was satisfactory but I'll probably try something different on my next visit.  I think they are still working on their beer list.  They didn't have any of their own beers and the big craft brewers like Sierra Nevada, Four Peaks and I believe it was New Belgium dominated the tap list.  I did like my Dragoon IPA and hope they continue to broaden their offerings with smaller unique brewers.

cozUaqglA__3AzS0WH1LwQ.text: Had a good time here. Nice selection and food was spot on. First time in Tempe but I will definitely make this a spot when I come in town for business. Convenient and very close to stadium and campus for football games.

Ca6bEgrIUQm88YVqv8a9qQ.text: I love this place i come in every monday the food is delicious and the staff is so kind i cant wait to come back

hdDyCmgbyUWBN7077F07VQ.text: Very cool / hip looking place indoors and out. Our server was very friendly. The catered food they walked by us with to a large corporate party on the outside looked impressive.  My hubby's opened faced ham sandwich was tasty but my kale and romaine salad with a $6 shrimp add on (in addition to the $9 base price) was not worth it. Neither were the (2) brisket egg rolls for $10. Also, they were completely out of the first 3 beers we chose off of the printed beer menu.  We will be back, but only during happy hour or during their $12 (?) breakfast buffet.

AYtc1lvkOHG_yWb50LUrTw.text: We have come to bring down the Haus.   Pardon me.   This is a long overdue review for a brewery that we have known about for at least a year. This is, in every sense, a cool establishment. It is located next to the AMC nestled in Downtown Tempe, a central hub of stores, bars, and restaurants alike. Pedal Haus sits upon a good spot with both indoor and outdoor seating; the circular outdoor arrangements are well-shaded and blessed with steady mist on the hot days. For today, we went inside.  We were hangry, so getting the layout was out of the question. I had but one destination: the table upon which food and drink appeared. Our server was quick to take our orders and remained attentive and helpful throughout. As Happy Hour was still going on, I ordered a slightly discounted staple from the Haus itself: German Pilsner (5.7% ABV), just something to cool off and gently infiltrate my bloodstream. It was perfect for this occasion, light and crisp, and there are many alternatives on their impressive menu of libations.   For food, we ordered the Bavarian Pretzels and a White Truffle Mushroom Pizza to share. Let us begin with the pretzels -- I greatly enjoyed them. It is only slightly irksome that they are prepared in threes; I am more compelled by the voluminous side of Haus Beer Cheese, along with the small but powerful side of mustard. The pretzels are gregariously buttered and salted, so expect a savory starter if you go with this option. The pizza was "eh" -- a fond but unremarkable memory of tasty, herby flatbreads on greasy parchment paper. Still, these meals stood no chance against our appetites. They were good (very good with the beer).  A note about indoor seating, which we believed was more fitting for our dinner: LOUD NOISES. The interior is noisy because the music is loud. I can do without the background cacophony; without it, we would be chatting with our company and would greatly minimize the instances of, "What?!" or "Huh??" from two feet away.   All of this accounted for, I am pleased to have at last crossed Pedal Haus off the list. Because of the lack of easy accessibility (I turn my back on paid parking structures most of the time), a sequel is a respectable ways away. However, it is satisfying to know that the food and drink they... pedal here will not disappoint when we return (did you get it? Oh, sue me). In an effort to preserve our vocal cords, we will plan on outdoor seating for next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Forgive the photo lighting; behold the beer lighting. Pedal Haus German Pils.
Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. The almighty Bavarian Pretzels with Haus beer cheese and a mustard side with a kick.
Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mushroom White Truffle Pizza. By no means bad, but also not something to write home about.

P4kQR4-vqE3eCwVGOpOoIg.text: I visited with my girlfriend and another couple on a Saturday evening, arriving at 5pm. We came here because it is one of the "dinner and a show" options that give a discount if you are seeing a show at Gammage in Tempe.   We were seated promptly when we arrived, as we had a reservation. Unfortunately, it took about 15 minutes for a server to greet us once we were seated. We watched many servers walk past us with no acknowledgement that were sitting there with no service. We ordered drinks, which came to our table about 10 minutes later.   We then ordered the Brussel sprouts and goat cheese appetizer, which came out fairly quickly and was very good. It was sweet and perfectly cooked.  For dinner, I ordered the buttermilk chicken dinner. I received the buttermilk chicken salad instead. When we told the server, he apologized but did not offer to replace it with the correct entree. The salad was decent, but it was a bit of disappointment, as it was not what I ordered.  One of our party ordered grilled onions with her classic burger, which did not come out with the order. She told the food runner, who said he would be right back with them, and he never came back.   The "dinner and a show" discount was supposed to be $1 house beers. We ordered a total of 3 beers. We notified the server after ordering the 3rd beer to make sure that we would receive the discount. He advised that they would only apply the discount on one drink per table, not per ticket stub as it says on the website.  The restaurants' website also states they will give $2 off the tab to cover the first hour of parking. When we presented our 2 stubs from the parking garage (1 per couple), he said it was only 1 per table.   We spoke to the manager and explained our somewhat unpleasant experience. He was apologetic and promptly offered to resolve it. He returned with a new tab, that was cut in half.   I am not one that normally complains, as I understand the plight of restaurants trying to satisfy their customers. We were not expecting a 50% discount, we just wanted what we ordered and a few bucks off a few beers and $4 off for parking.   Overall this is a decent place for a meal and drinks. The pricing is good for the quality and quantity of food you receive, but the service is not great. It seems as though the management is aware, and they are doing what they can to make people happy. They should work on training their servers regarding policies and speed of service to improve.

0mMtzShQeT5_fOWt1A3BcA.text: This place has been reliably strong for us. Their beers are nice, although I wish they had a bit more rotation. Food is high quality, too. It's a notch above typical bar food, e.g., ribs, fried chicken, chicken pot pie, and their starters are really great, especially the corn fritters.   It's quite a loud environment, both inside and outside. It's often at capacity, so make reservations if you can during busy hours. Sometimes service is slow. But otherwise, this place is great.

mmU7SO1rUWITpCQghunTEw.text: I wouldn't select their loaded cheese fries with beef chili. While I liked the mozzarella curd and beer cheese, the beef chili didn't taste good to me. The fries were crispy and the beer cheese wasn't salty. Unfortunately, the beef chili tasted bad. Normally I never throw food away, but I had to this time. I have visited them before and their other appetizers were not too bad.   The service was pretty decent, but since the restaurant was open to the outside, it felt quite humid inside the restaurant. Also, the inside of the restaurant was pretty noisy. I had trouble hearing other people at my table. I think that the acoustics wasn't very good in the area in which we were seated. I have been there before and sat outside. When sitting outside, the noise levels were fine.

ILamXZVHz6cK-bqDOhdP-A.text: Really big cool patio. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Enjoyed talking with our server. Had the salmon salad which i liked. Also had the stout which was decent. Little loud in the restaurant area with the music. Overall enjoyed the experienxe

Af9ywV-WiBRPvljLvIMnEA.text: Great atmosphere - lackluster taste in the food!!  This restaurant must be a millions investment, but is lacking on chef spending -- need to spool it up!!  The service is good, but after a couple of visits, found the food is nothing to write home about... better choices out there....

nQInCzDwbbvK8ulobRjo4Q.text: This is my new favorite gastro pub! They brew their own beer in the back and have a great food menu. The place itself is modern industrial with an open, spread out feeling. The outdoor covered seating arrangement is beautiful to look at and are all equipped with misters for the AZ heat. Outdoor classic games like bag toss. There is a gorgeous water structure in front of the brewery with giant rabbits that make for a perfect Instagram photo op!   They're a scratch kitchen, so everything is unique and fresh. So far I have tried the nachos, Mac and cheese, and wings. I did see some tasty burgers pass me by too. Their portion sizes are generous, so come hungry. I like the wings the best so far, so much flavor, plus they are smoked then fried making them crispy yet tender.   Service is friendly, pricing is a little higher than average, but it is made up for in the amount of food they give you. We had a $65 tab after ordering 2 alcohol drinks and 3 food items.   Only thing I don't like about this place is the bathroom setup. The men and women's restrooms are only for toileting. The handwashing station and vanity mirrors are communal and  located outside in the common area. Kind of a bummer when you have braces like me and need to pick at your teeth and swish/gargle in private lol   All in all, I love the feel of this place and you will see all ages. It seems like a versatile place to hang out and have fun with friends and family, or a laid back date.

I think they were all decent just not my favorite beers. I didn't try the food there, but it looked pretty tasty.

TIztgpDfjSGkG53Md0Ndrw.text: Love this place! Located right off Mill Street, it's convenient to everything. I've visited with a group of people in the afternoon. It was a little chilly outside, so they had the fire pits roaring! What a great ambience. It was awesome to sit around with friends and enjoy the company and great beer.   Our group of seven moved to a table and since it was still too early for dinner, we each ordered a different appetizer and shared. They all tasted great!   The service was awesome! The staff was friendly!  The beer hit the spot. You can't go wrong here!

lNFEd1f7iM7-4gKhcpLF-g.text: This was one of our our last stops on the Tempe Brunch Crawl, and why haven't I heard of this place, or seen it before?? It is cute! The outdoor patio area is so nice. I love the jackrabbit statues outside of it, as well. We enjoyed a beer flight which was delightful. Our service was decent, too. The only weird thing about it, which isn't really a big deal just different - is that after you use the bathroom you have to exit the bathroom to wash your hands in the basin provided outside of it, right by the brewery area. It's always neat to walk by and check out the brewery though.  The beers we had were good, and we will definitely be back to check out the food. So far, we are impressed.

C-X97DxdB-eW5GI3FUwJ2g.text: The food was okay the experience was not the best. Came here on a on Friday night. (Tonight) Since the hosts weren't super accommodating from the beginning by seating us in the host place in the venue. We finished our dinner and moved to the inside bar cus it was too hot. After leaving from having a few drinks inside we see the turned on the misters. Thank you for my swamp butt during dinner.

rUWObQTaD0jKKn3mLFqzig.text: Being located just off Mill Avenue instead of on the main drag means that Pedal Haus, as a facility, has the space to spread out, making for a more leisurely, comfortable environment. My favorite spots to sit are the gazebo-type structures on the periphery that circle their individual fire pits.  The place offers some excellent craft beers and snacks to go along While drinking or snacking, you'll find plenty of bar and patio games to keep your hands occupied. Out of all the places in the Mill Avenue District, Pedal Haus has got to be one of my favorites

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Keep warm during the cold months!

Dto8c4LgrgTBf77x36X5MQ.text: So I've been coming to this place a lot more since I became a member of the AMC Plus next door. They have a decent selection of beers and have a perfect happy hour time. I haven't had any food here but I'm always seeing people ordering food and it looks rather delicious. It's also great for small and group settings.   My favorite part about this place is that they have ping pong and bags. Since it's been rather hot outside, me and literally anyone i go with has free range on the games which has brought me back.   Also, the vibe of this place is really cool. The lighting is dim and intimidate. It would be a great place for a date since the music isn't very loud at all. And i know it's been hot but they do have misters that make the heat more bearable which is nice. I highly suggest coming to this spot for a drink before or after a movie.

zpGwfZ44AOTC1YZp04hHVA.text: The location is great. A good spot for a quick drink and appetizers. I wouldn't rate them too high only because when I came here, I ordered their chicken wings, which was cold when I bit into it, however, their fries was seasoned well. Service is alright, as well. I can give this place a try again in the future but I hope I can eat warm chicken.

FDDuDFw8wX8kPKIWYKVvMQ.text: A fun place to grab beer and good food.  Nothing fancy but the food, service and beer made here are very  good. They have misters on that make sitting outside in Tempe comfortable.  The lager and Pilsners are light and full of flavor...they also have beers from other breweries too. Right across from ASU, it's usually busy and loud but really good energy!  Burgers are excellent...

LOPfWapTasu7HYlinLzCOw.text: I was headed down to Phoenix from Minneapolis to see a buddy and I had some time to explore by myself for a few hours before heading down to Sun Lakes, so I took the light rail 3 stops from the airport (Which was an experience in itself)  I looked for brewpubs and found this place on Mill Street, which I hung out on 25 years ago when I lived in Tempe during High School.  School was out, so it was pretty empty about 11:30 AM, so I sat right down at one of the outdoor bar stools. I saw 2 prices on the menu, 5/9, I asked what the difference was and they said you can get a beer for 5 bucks or a 1 liter stein for $9. 9 please!  I ordered an IPA and it was solid and fruity and I got another stein of one of their pale ales.   Great beer, cool glasses, great service and I got a few free stickers.  Five stars all around.  No food this time, but it was a great hour experiencing Mill Street again after more than 2 decades.

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. American Hoppy Lager in the large stein

GhV2hw6N7WudhSHCa8jBbQ.text: This is a really cool place with good food and drinks. We were just there for something lighter around happy hour so my friends and I shared the Deviled Egg Dip and each got a margarita. It was all delicious and the margaritas are huge! Service was friendly and fast. They have plenty of space and indoor/outdoor seating areas, too. Definitely check this place out if you're in the area.

QKBFx1Rr-QmvXiSfgS6n4g.text: I recently went out to this place when we were downtown for a christmas parade. I have walked by it many times, and I will say I was pleasantly surprised. I will break it down as best as I can.  Decor: The brewery has an amazing set up with indoor, outdoor seating. The outdoor seating also includes firepits for larger groups, which is the best attraction for me as a consumer. They have an adult play area with cornhole and ping pong tables. Inside they have a pizza oven where you can see everything being cooked. I LOVED this, it really drew attention to the kitchen.  Food: Ok, so I'm not gonna lie, I went all out. I wanted nachos like it's nobodies business. They had a 2lb nacho, and good god was it good. They queso, the green chile chicken, the everything omg. So that was a great start. Then we ordered the philly cheesesteak, and a couple drinks. The cheesesteak was honestly made amazingly. They used cheese spread, WHICH IS LEGIT. The only thing I would've loved to have was sauted peppers as well. Otherwise, the kitchen knows damn well how to make some amazing food!  Customer Service: The place was super busy that night, and granted our server was around, but we would've liked to be helped a little more. I had to walk around and find help on multiple times, which was a little annoying, but I need the exercise.

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. This is the Philly Cheesesteak, YOU NEED TO TRY IT

Ysk-Xgi5OLwIrJHRaAFgvg.text: We're baaaack! Now our son is moved into ASU, we've come back to this favorite of ours. Great service by waitress, manager and bar. Shishito peppers and Bavarian pretzel were tasty! My buffalo wings were some of the best I've tasted! Family loved their meals as we took turns playing shuffleboard. What a fun place!

kZAYP-J82Ta1zc-glT9CVg.text: We will most definitely be back to this place.   We encountered a couple of problems however they did fix everything they possibly could.   Let's start off with the service. Our waitress Taylor was very attentive even with all of the tables she had.  She did ask us if it was our first time here and we advised her it was however she didn't tell us of any specials or that it was happy hour so that was a bummer. I would have most definitely tried other items if I would have known. But again, she was so nice, very friendly, and did make us laugh.   Now the food and drinks. The chicken wings were soooooo good! We had the bbq wings and the buffalo wings with a side of fries. Our first order was incorrect however they corrected it immediately which was very nice to see.  The chicken wings were very juicy and cooked perfectly. Probably one of the best order of wings I've had down mill ave.  The fries... oh the fries... please bring a breath mint if you order them. Although they were delicious I could not get over how strong the garlic smell was. I literally had to put it at the edge of the table.   The margarita was also one of the best I've had. It was consistent! Normally down on mill you can't really get consistent drinks unless it's wine, beer, or frozen margaritas. My boyfriend tried 3 different types of beer and he really liked it.   The atmosphere is great! You have the option of sitting outside or inside and of course with the nice weather there was a wait to sit outside. It was a little hot and a little dark inside but overall a great atmosphere as well. This wasn't your typical mill ave place. It was an "older" crowd but a fun one which was very nice to see.   The reason for 4 stars is bc they do not have dessert. It's on the menu but they don't have any. I ordered some and the waitress came back and informed me they didn't have any and that they don't really sell dessert here. This for sure would have been a 5 star rating if they did.   Overall, it was a wonderful experience and we will make this a regular spot for sure.

pmK0wi1gLLW_DmjaP75J3A.text: So came here because of the Yelp reviews and I wanted to make sure that I ate at a place that had good reviews.   As I walked in, I saw a cool outdoor patio area where you can have a circular booth with friends and have a conversation or regular tables. The cool thing was that the had the mister going on outside since it was really hot.   So I got the Biere Blanche since it's local and went with the Falafel Burger. Let me take a few bites and let you know how it went .......  Garlic fries were a great addition to the burger and the fries didn't taste like you could get them just at any store. I was surprised by the taste of the Falafel Burger and it was pretty amazing. The condiments and garnishment was on point. 5 stars for the hostess, the waitress, the food and the atmosphere!

hBz2PEd72aevm0NJEpmWjg.text: I grew up in Tempe and remember when Islands was at this location and then it sat empty for some time after it closed. But is looks like Tempe finally found a winner in Pedal Haus. It is a locally owned brewpub that features handcrafted European-style beers along with a Belgian-American gastropub menu. They opened in 2015 and just recently went through a renovation. They have some pretty creative dishes like brisket ragu pasta, lobster mac & cheese, tempura-fried cheese curds and moules frites. You can't miss this place because it is huge. They have three bar areas with an enormous patio (with cornhole) and beer garden. I was first introduced to Pedal Haus on a food tour of Tempe last year and happy to finally make a return visit. I started my day off with the Bavarian pretzel which comes with sides of beer cheese, stone-ground mustard and a maple butter. The pretzels are shaped liked a baguette and come served warm and soft. The maple butter was a pleasant surprise. Then I got the Green Chili Bacon Burger which is a pretty good-sized burger loaded with all types of flavor. I'm an ale guy and enjoyed their amber ale for my beer choice. One fun fact that I found interesting is that they recycle heat in the brewing process. The steam (which is typically lost) is distributed to a hot water tank that warms up the next batch. They have a killer happy hour that offers reduced prices on their appetizers and beer. Like many of the new breweries opening up, they are pet friendly, so feel free to bring your dog.

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Green Chili Bacon Burger
Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bavarian Pretzel
Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Amber Ale

MNKGJhqlzFR7mgZGbV8ACw.text: This place has a really cool set up and good music, but both mine and my friends pizza came out burnt and I had to wait 20 min for a water refill when servers would would pass right by my empty cup at the end of the table and never refilled it once, server came back and said "sorry" when I could see her talking to other servers and taking care of other tables. Probably won't come back.

DhQSZU3xbm0wAt6weh-8jg.text: Sunday football rocked at Pedal House. Sever was a lot of fun and had great recommendations

wFkP2Wsz0zF0gyLL30HjTw.text: Sunday night dinner. Guac and chips were outstanding. Guac if made from fresh avocados. The miso salmon was tasty, especially the dressing made from scratch. Lots of salmon pieces. Brisket ragu pasta was better than my mom used to make. The pasta is homemade fresh. Brisket was juicy and tender. The sauce very tasty like a beef stew yet was so light. I highly recommend for a great meal accompanied by their outstanding beer selection they make in house.

Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Brisket Ragu Pasta

0jgoisQ-kEmX3y1rfQoRpg.text: I came here for lunch around 12:30pm on a weekday with some of the people in my department. It wasn't packed at all. Albeit, the place is huge, but there were probably only five or tables that were filled.   I ordered the Green Chili Burger [$13], and we shared the Pub Deviled Eggs [$6]. The burger was pretty good; the meat was juicy and the bread was nice and big. I asked for the haus slaw. For the price, it's probably smaller than what it was worth. The location is nice, and I love the decor (the whole bicycle theme going on). The deviled eggs were deviled eggs, nothing different from what you probably had at a friend's house.   The service was spectacularly slow. The food was good, nothing too special, but had everything else been going right, then I wouldn't mind going to Pedal Haus to meet with friends and have grub here. However, the waitress who was assigned to our table was so busy with the other restaurant goers that we remained forgotten for the most part. The place wasn't that busy either, so I'm not sure what was going on.   In conclusion, if a friend suggests this place, okay, I'll go, but I don't see myself actively seeking this place out to have lunch.

cUqblb4qkkWrcC53mi_i6A.text: Wasn't impressed with our waitress Allison's service tonight! It took her 10-15min to greet my table once we were sat. On top of that, we were there for 2 hours and she came to check in on us 3 times, 2 of those times I had to track her down.   As I spoke to the manager, he advised he was short staffed. However, Allison checked in on the tables around my table plenty of times. Once I got the manager involved Allison's demeanor changed and the attitude came out!   We did not get an apology for the bad service out of Allison's mouth nor a thank you after she dropped off the bill.   Thanks for my first visit at the Pedal!

yuFkdUYqJJ8Oo8C0h76WBw.text: I've been here for over an hour and can't seem to get any type of service...not busy, no wait! I've had to ask 3 times for someone to come take a food order! What the hell is going on? So ridiculous...horrible

5YDZPAEpcmxjFTGkjBIvNw.text: Tough to write because I loved it the first time I went. But my family was visiting and I suggested Pedal Haus because it had something for everyone - seafood, burgers, and good drinks. So we made a reservation for a Friday evening.   We were seated in the middle of the silo and the music was so loud - my grandparents thought so and even I, a college student, agreed. I literally got a headache. Then our food took an hour to come because of a 30-person party before us. The waitress was super nice and apologetic and the manager came out and said he'd cover our first round of drinks.   Finally when our food came my family enjoyed theirs but I was disappointed with my lobster mac n cheese - first of all, they gave me bacon mac n cheese which I identified immediately and told the server, who assured me it was lobster. I thought the customer was always right? Anyway, I finally convinced him that it wasn't in fact lobster and they gave me what I ordered. It was soupy and bitter. Not a fan.   Throughout this my grandparents were very amicable and understanding but it got to a point where we were tired of waiting and HUNGRY.   We paid for our drinks, the manager ended up paying for our meals (I swear I saw him shaking his head as we walked away), and we tipped the poor waitress well.   Probably won't return. Sad because I liked it the first time!

KnWeUO2-MH7Zkx2MvXphDw.text: I am not exactly what changed in the last renovation of Pedal Haus but on my last trip (August 2017) the food was substantially better. This may have been the best fried fish I have had in town, the oil was obviously fresh - the biggest problem with good fried fish - and the temperature right. The deviled egg dip was a first for me. It rocked my socks but there has to be something better than chips for that...maybe some old school homemade Melba toast is in order. Here's to hoping the improved evening wasn't a fluke!

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Deviled egg dip, fried fish in background.

s2qZ2HcR80OLLw0AG9NBKw.text: Don't come to this bar if you're trying to have a good time. My group and I came to celebrate a birthday. One or two drinks in, about half of us got "cut off" in a very condescending way. This bar used to be very enjoyable but the heavier guy with the beard is not good at dealing with customers. Will not be returning any time soon.  RE: I had not even finished one drink and was laughing with my friend when challenged. Not sure how that fits into the safety guidelines.

tmwYge3_qBBTDYv_ZOq-xw.text: Enjoyed the service and food.    Noticed a "we validate sign" on the way out so asked.....they said the policy changed a month ago but the sign is still there.    Why don't they take down the sign?    Server had no idea.

7Jjmrlj70vW98KuMjPSVtg.text: The pot pie was amazing! It was nice going to a brew pub that had elevated pub food. A must try!

nvfNLw_bTxrjfGjwasAfrQ.text: Honestly, best restaurant/brewery in the area! Hands down, food is amazing, beers are amazing! Tripel is my current favorite, but definitely miss the Rauchbier! And can't say enough about the amazing staff!!! Everybody from the owner Julian jumping behind the bar when it's a complete mess during the Michigan State vs. ASU game to Dan (when he stops in! ) Nick, Aaron, and Alex amazing management! The bartenders, man, where to start! Chris, Judson, Cheri, Kelly, Colby, Caleb, and even the new girl Whitney! Just awesome! The servers, whew! Kayla, Arian, Lyss, both Jordan's, Andrew, Kyle, Meghan, and all the others I can't remember currently! Then we have the SA's like the amazing Maka that is helping me remember names , Sydney, and Janelle! Just absolutely amazing staff, food, and beer! Can't say enough good things about this place!!! wish i could give this place 10 stars!!! Oh, I almost forgot about the back of the house staff from Patrick and George to all the other cooks and back of the house staff!!!

XTS--MkTzvm9kObwhSoX5Q.text: "It's all about the Beer and supporting local business"   11AM Monday morning and about time for a beer or two. Being a Kolsch and coffee fan I'm down with trying the Koffee Kolsch from Huss really interesting aroma coffee notes finishes clean. Next up wanted to try a Nitro beer and the Maple Milk stout was way too sweet, sure you can use adjuncts like maple syrup and milk sugar shouldn't it ferment out a little more and not overpower the beer? Here is where the 5 star comes in the barkeeps suggests another nitro and the Firestone Walker Velvet Merlin is like perfection in a glass some sweetness finishes smooth tight creamy head.  Didn't stick around long enough for the Gemultlichkeit to kick in.

photos.caption: Photo of Pedal Haus Brewery - Tempe, AZ, United States. Firestone Walker Velvet Merlin Oatmeal Stout Nitro

XClxQ-yXNEW_Y0igCMQy-w.text: Have you tried the wings? No, seriously, have you? Get the wings, naked with sauce on the side. They come perfectly fried and lightly seasoned with salt and pepper. After grubbing head over to the beer garden for some table tennis or corn hole. The only improvement I would make would be pep up the service a big, staff could be a little better trained but overall a pretty decent spot for lunch, happy hour and a night out with friends!

3N-g9Jewyyc3ZrS_gJA8yg.text: This place was so good, I almost wanted to come back the next day, like asap! My friend and I both had salads, they were both good sized portions and both innovative recipes and tasty.  They were also quite healthy and fresh.  I was pleasantly surprised to try a Pedal Haus brew for $3 on Happy Hour (it was amazing actually. Reminded me of one of the best beers I've tried in Belgium).  The service from both manager/owner and waitress was outstanding.  My friend and I sat outside in the beer garden, it was super fun!  Loved the lawn chair circle as well.  I definitely recommend.  Not often I give 5 stars but this place earned it.

d7w42DNILIqPs2iyYV2O5w.text: First time here and loving it. Food is great, fast service and interior is just amazing. Must visit!
